cs34q.turtle

Class Turtle

  • java.lang.Object
    • cs34q.turtle.Turtle

  • public class Turtle
extends java.lang.Object
    The Turtle class maintains the position and bearing of the "turtle" in turtle graphics.

    • Constructor Summary

      • isPenDown

        public boolean isPenDown()
        Returns:
        true if the turtle's pen is down (i.e. it will leave a visible trail as it moves)

      • copyFrom

        public void copyFrom(Turtle t)

      • displace

        public void displace(double dist)
        Move the turtle by the given distance, in the direction of its current heading.
        Parameters:
        dist - The distance (in pixels) to displace the turtle by.

      • turn

        public void turn(double angleInDegs)
        Rotate the turtle anti-clockwise by the given angle.
        Parameters:
        angleInDegs - The angle of turn for the turtle, provided in degrees

        Set the state of the turtle's pen.
        Parameters:
        state - The desired state of the pen.

        public void home()
        Send the turtle to its default position.

      • addListener

        public void addListener(TurtleListener l)
        Add a listener to this turtle.
        Parameters:
        l - The listener to be added to the list already listening for mutation events on this turtle.

        protected void fireSentHome()

      • deriveDisplaced

        public Turtle deriveDisplaced(double dist)
        Move the turtle by the given displacement (which may be negative), without changing its current bearing. A new turtle is returned.
        Parameters:
        dist - The distance to deriveDisplaced the turtle by.
        Returns:
        A new Turtle instance representing the new position of the turtle.

      • deriveTurned

        public Turtle deriveTurned(double angle)
        Rotate the turtle by the given angle (which may be negative), without changing its current position. A new turtle is returned.
        Parameters:
        angle - The angle by which to deriveTurned anti-clockwise (it may be negative to represent a clockwise deriveTurned).
        Returns:
        A new Turtle instance representing the new orientation of the turtle.

      • derivePenDown

        public Turtle derivePenDown(boolean state)
        Set the state of the pen (either up or down).
        Parameters:
        state - true to put the pen down
        Returns:
        A new Turtle instance in the same position and orientation, but with the pen in the specified state.

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
